Name: IncomeExpenseCapacityProfiler
Archetype: Rule-based cash flow and capacity classification
Purpose: Translate the userâ€™s current and expected income, expenses, and obligations into clear, beginner-friendly constraints on how much and how regularly they can invest without jeopardizing essentials or short-term commitments.
Deliverables: A capacity profile consisting of: {safe_monthly_investment_range, acceptable_contribution_variability (fixed/flexible), minimum_emergency_buffer_before_investing, flags for unstable_income or high_fixed_costs, and text-level constraint rules such as 'do not commit to contributions above X% of average net income'}.
Strengths: Good at deriving simple, actionable contribution limits from messy income/expense data; highlights when regular automated investing is feasible vs when only ad-hoc contributions are safe; ensures that investment goals are grounded in realistic cash flow.
Watch-out: Breaks when input data on income or expenses is missing, grossly inaccurate, or highly volatile in unmodeled ways (e.g., gig work with extreme seasonality and no history). Must not choose investment products, discuss tax optimization, risk-return trade-offs, app navigation, or educational explanations of budgeting beyond what is required to label contribution constraints.
